text: Life After Youth is the third full-length album by Canadian indie rock band Land of Talk, released May 19, 2017 on Dine Alone Records in Canada"Land of Talk: Life After Youth". Exclaim!, May 17, 2017. and Saddle Creek Records in the United States."After A Detour, Land Of Talk's Elizabeth Powell Finds A New Way Home". NPR Music, May 19, 2017. The album's release followed a seven year hiatus."Land of Talk: Life After Youth". Pitchfork Media, May 18, 2017. The album was nominated for Best Alternative Album at the Juno Awards of 2018."Juno Awards Reveal 2018 Nominees". Exclaim!, February 6, 2018. ==Track listing== ==Reviews== Upon the album's release the album was generally well- received by critics with NPRhttps://www.npr.org/2017/05/11/527657111/first- listen-land-of-talk-life-after-youth giving the album a positive review along with The Irish Times where the album went on to receive a four out of a five- star rating stating the album as "the most intriguing album of immersive, de- stressed guitar pop-rock you’ll hear this summer".https://www.irishtimes.com/culture/music/album-reviews/land-of-talk- deliver-a-shoo-in-for-the-end-of-year-lists-1.3082612 Pitchfork gave the album a rating of 7.0 within the review it stated the album is "full of unpredictable songwriting twists and poetically opaque lyrics".https://pitchfork.com/reviews/albums/23242-life-after-youth/ Paste Magazine gave the album an 8.6 rating.https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2017/05/land-of-talk-life-after- youth-review.html == References == Category:2017 albums Category:Land of Talk albums Category:Saddle Creek Records albums Category:Dine Alone Records albums
title: Life After Youth
